*note: these are as close as I can remember, because it died about a month ago, real time*

I'm not trying to seem pushy for a bunch of answers, I just want to be able to get the better ranching experience. Such as:

Getting through + Adventures
Winning a S Official (haha, yea, I'm not kidding)
Finding Rainbow Disks

By Iron_Datu on Thursday, September 1, 2005 - 12:07 pm:

We are probably wasting space here. And I will not be surprised or offended if this thread is deleted asap.

1) Getting through Adventure+ Areas- Well before you try this you will (for an easy time) need a good (not necessarily uber/maxxed)creature. I'm sorry but its been a looong time since i played through the "initial" stages(pre-wonderwell/wind drum). But I recall we had 2 "magic" medals and so we produced a magic sandbag and a magic trampoline. To get such medals just adventure over and over in the normal areas.

With such devices you can power up a spd/power creature like Garu so he can take on Kawrea Normal and perhaps Togle Caves+. This may take time but if you adventure a LOT, you can get some of the items you will need.

General training tips that may be of use:

a) Use Oily oil regularly on the creature you want to power up the most.

b) Feed with watermelon (or peach if watermelon is disliked)

c) Try to make the gadgets on your farm cater to similar creatures (Pow/Def or Spd/Int) so you can remove superfluous ones. Of course if you really plan ahead you can schedule removal and placement with the arrival of the gadget guys. But Im lazy so...

d) Train a creature with good gains and a 4 yr lifespan. Focus on its 2 main attributes. Pls go to the appropriate thread on monsters to select.


2) Winning S Official- Well this is really linked to what creatures you can breed successfully which is linked to your gadgets. So if you like Def/Pow creatures please check out the method I outlined here:

Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 4 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here) : Monster Breeding Methods...

Also read the very interesting thread:

Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 4 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here) : Maxed Monsters?

This thread (ignore the golden peaches wierdo) contains information which I think can lead to a maxxed monster.

3) Finding Rainbow Disks- I have personally found many rainbow disks in Promiass+ at level 11 if you search the whole thing. But generally it is random according to many ranchers. Frequency of adventuring will be crucial- so that uber monster will definitely be needed. Also bring along a sacrificial Jell to do all the searching ^_^.

By Iron_Datu on Friday, September 2, 2005 - 03:24 am:

@PT- Thank you for your confidence, however I have to acknowledge the great help MRM has been having provided me crucial information that I merely built on. Also, my brother- darkdatu- helped a great deal.

I have week to week notes on the last creature we raised a golem that reached 3900 composite. I noted the weekly results of training and roughly what it ate and what its status was before and after feeding, training, scolding, praise etc. I hope to post a summary of that near the end of this month- can't post sooner due to exams.

@Pandimonia- One last piece of info, even when you have a "good" creature with 2 high attributes (Spd/Int, Pow/Def, etc, both in the 650-800 range) and a reasonable amt of Acc and Lif (400-500+), adventure+ areas will still NOT be easy- which is why Normal Mode and Togle Caves+ are advisable at that point. Lucky counter attacks can force a reload. Of course you can retreat from combat, I just don't like to.

Even with a 3500+ creature Kawrea+ is also still dangerous-which is why Promiass+ for me is ideal for rainbow stones-lvl 11, and toughheart acquisition- lvl 10 is where i get most of them. So at the end of the day, just keep at it.

By Iron_Datu on Sunday, September 4, 2005 - 09:32 pm:

@MrGG
No problem ^_^. Our last creature was a golem- Brutacus who had the following stats (3926 composite):

4 yrs/2 mos
Lif: 812
Pow: 999
Int:49
Acc: 999
Spd: 68
Def: 999

If we had not gone on adventures during his adult period, he could have hit 4000 or slightly over.

@Pandimonia
Press SELECT when in creature combat. You wil be given an option to "Give Up". If you do your creature will lose some energy in addition to whatever damage he/she has already sustained. So retreating a lot is not the best option.

By Iron_Datu on Monday, September 5, 2005 - 09:46 am:

@Pandimonia

Oh yes as to your question. We use mostly magic and healing medals because of the wonderwell/wind drum combo. Also, we use lvl 2 and lvl 4 training only at present. I don't recall using intense or lvl 3 much, so I can't really say. I ditched lvl 3 devices because lvl 4 is better, and IMHO lvl 2 Magic devices are also superior in many ways to lvl 3. Happy ranching!

By Apocalypse on Wednesday, January 4, 2006 - 03:48 pm:

By Iron_Datu on Wednesday, February 15, 2006 - 11:58 am:

@Apocalypse

Sorry for late reply,I have been greatly engrossed in mundane matters-RE4! and brainless MMORPGS. Anyway, the gadgets and method I used are stated in:

Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 4 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here) : Monster Breeding Methods...

Focused Farm Method

Gadgets Required:

The following will be cycled in and out of the ranch as needed:

1) Magic Sand Bag (MSbag)
2) Healing Tub (HTub)
3) Healing Target AND/OR Magic Target (HTgt/MTgt)
4) Healing Lifeblade (HLb)
5) Healing Pendulum (HPend)

The following should always be on the ranch:

6) Wind Drum (placed to touch as many of the other gadgets as possible)
7) Bragma Statue (placed to touch as many of the other gadgets as possible)
8) Wonder Well

As far as I recall those are what I used.

By Apocalypse on Wednesday, February 15, 2006 - 12:47 pm:

Ok thanx! I see you are another person who thinks Int. is overrated : ) I will definitely try this method.

By Iron_Datu on Monday, February 20, 2006 - 10:53 am:

@Apocalypse

Hmmm. No I do not think that Int is overrated, it just happened that my Brother and I developed this method after analyzing the gadgets and the stats that could be trained together. The Healing pendulum is an important gadget since it increases Power and Defense at the cost of a stat (INT) that the creature has only a few or no good attacks with.

Ultimately we saw that getting Pow and Def up to 999 quickly would mean that skill could be raised to 999 as well, leaving enough training time to raise Health up significantly enough to survive attacks. Spd would similarly be raised minimally since a high Def would mean that hits would generally do negligible damage.

I do not think that Int is overrated, its a matter of training creatures in the stats that they have the best gains in. It just happens that Durahan and Golem are among my favorites. Now if there were a level 4 device for SPD and INT that did not reduce accuracy that would be ideal for a similar method for Int creatures.

Actually I have been working on a method focusing on SPD/INT creatures and on trying to attain a creature with a composite of over 4500. But again due to other activities I am making slow headway, mea culpa, anyway happy ranching!
